data.Title: Google Cracks Down on Explicit Deepfakes
data.Description: Google is taking steps to combat the spread of nonconsensual, sexually explicit deepfakes. The search giant announced new policies and algorithm updates aimed at making it harder to find such content.  Google is also expanding its "About this image" feature to provide more context about images found online.

data.Title: Reddit Demands Payment for AI Search Data
data.Description: Reddit is pushing back against AI companies scraping its data for training without permission. The company's CEO criticized Microsoft, Anthropic, and Perplexity, stating that Reddit has gone to great lengths to block them.  He emphasized that these companies need to pay to access Reddit's valuable data for search.

data.Title: Wix Introduces AI-Powered Blog Post Writer
data.Description: Wix's new AI feature will write entire blog posts, incorporating user-specified SEO keywords. This tool aims to simplify content creation and enhance organic traffic for Wix users.

data.Title: Microsoft Highlights AI's Role in Combating Election Misinformation
data.Description: A new report from Microsoft emphasizes the challenges and opportunities presented by AI in addressing election misinformation and harmful deepfakes. The report underscores the urgency of protecting people from the potential dangers of AI-generated content.

data.Title: Perplexity to Share Ad Revenue with Publishers
data.Description: Following accusations of plagiarism, Perplexity is launching a program to share ad revenue with publishing partners. When Perplexity features content from these publishers in response to user queries, the publishers will receive a portion of the ad revenue generated.
